snippet: Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert acknowledged that the drop in class of a stakes-caliber racehorse may have looked suspicious but insisted he sent a sound horse to the track.
abstract: Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert insists that 5-year-old gelding Tweebster, euthanized following an injury sustained in a cheap claiming race at Santa Anita Park, was sound when sent to the track; Baffert's statements come in response to public criticism pointing out horse's precipitous drop in class as telltale sign of unsoundness.
lead_paragraph: Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert acknowledged that the drop in class of a stakes-caliber racehorse may have looked suspicious but insisted he sent a sound horse to the track.

headline.seo: Questions for Baffert After Tweebster Is Euthanized
headline.main: Baffert’s Horse Is Euthanized After Claiming Race, but Some Wonder Why It Was Running
headline.print_headline: Baffert’s Horse Is Euthanized After Claiming Race, but Some Wonder Why It Was Running
